addonManifest.name: Amazon EMR
addonManifest.description: Amazon EMR is a service that allows you to set up, operate and scale Hadoop MapReduce jobs.
addonManifest.author: Abraham Sultan and Daniel Domkowski, edited by Chris Dutra

property.description: If set to true, each developer will need to provide their own Amazon credentials.
JSON string adding anything additional to the request
Sets the value of the AMI version. For most cases, use 'latest'
List of Bootstrap Actions, place in text format to be parsed.
A specification on the number of instances and type of EC2 instances on which to run the job flow. Place in text format to be parsed.
The IAM role for the job flow. The EC2 instances of the job flow use this role.
S3 Bucket URI for storing log files. If not specified, logs will not be provided.

A list of strings that indicates third-party software to use with the job flow that accepts a user argument list. EMR accepts and forwards the argument list to the corresponding installation script as bootstrap action arguments. Currently, values can be 'mapr-m3', 'mapr-m5'
IAM role that Amazon uses to provision resources on your behalf during the job flow. Must be an existing IAM role.
List of steps to be executed by the job flow. When provisioning, this is usually going to be empty.
List of Tags to associate with a cluster and its respective EC2 instnaces.
If true, all IAM users of the AWS account can see/manage the job flow. Set to false to make this restricted to just the IAM user.
